name: Apple___Apple_scab
cause: Caused by the fungus Venturia inaequalis, thriving in wet conditions.
solution_pesticide: Apply captan or sulfur-based fungicides.
solution_organic: Use neem oil and improve air circulation.

name: Apple___Black_rot
cause: Caused by the fungus Botryosphaeria obtusa, spreading through infected leaves and fruits.
solution_pesticide: Use fungicides containing thiophanate-methyl or captan.
solution_organic: Prune infected branches and apply copper-based sprays.

name: Apple___Cedar_apple_rust
cause: Caused by the fungus Gymnosporangium juniperi-virginianae, requiring juniper as an alternate host.
solution_pesticide: Apply myclobutanil or mancozeb fungicides.
solution_organic: Remove nearby juniper plants and use sulfur-based sprays.

name: Apple___healthy
cause: No disease detected, plant is in good condition.
solution_pesticide: Regular monitoring and preventive fungicide application.
solution_organic: Maintain proper spacing, prune dead branches, and ensure good air circulation.

name: Blueberry___healthy
cause: No disease detected, plant is in good condition.
solution_pesticide: Ensure regular monitoring and apply preventive treatments if needed.
solution_organic: Mulch with pine needles and ensure proper irrigation.

name: Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew
cause: Caused by Podosphaera clandestina, leading to white powdery spots on leaves.
solution_pesticide: Use sulfur-based fungicides or myclobutanil.
solution_organic: Apply neem oil or baking soda spray.

name: Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy
cause: No disease detected, plant is in good condition.
solution_pesticide: Preventive monitoring and fungicide application if necessary.
solution_organic: Maintain good air circulation and avoid excessive humidity.

name: Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray_leaf_spot
cause: Caused by the fungus Cercospora zeae-maydis, spreading in humid conditions.
solution_pesticide: Use azoxystrobin or propiconazole-based fungicides.
solution_organic: Rotate crops and ensure proper field drainage.

name: Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_
cause: Caused by the fungus Puccinia sorghi, appearing as reddish-brown pustules.
solution_pesticide: Apply strobilurin or triazole fungicides.
solution_organic: Grow resistant varieties and remove infected plants.

name: Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight
cause: Caused by Exserohilum turcicum, leading to elongated lesions on leaves.
solution_pesticide: Apply fungicides containing mancozeb or azoxystrobin.
solution_organic: Rotate crops and avoid planting maize in infected fields.

name: Corn_(maize)___healthy
cause: No disease detected, plant is in good condition.
solution_pesticide: Maintain proper pest control and apply preventive fungicides if needed.
solution_organic: Ensure good spacing and irrigation practices.

name: Grape___Black_rot
cause: Caused by the fungus Guignardia bidwellii, forming brown spots on leaves and fruits.
solution_pesticide: Use mancozeb or myclobutanil fungicides.
solution_organic: Prune infected vines and ensure proper ventilation.

name: Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles)
cause: Caused by a fungal complex affecting older grapevines, causing wood decay.
solution_pesticide: No chemical treatment available; remove infected vines.
solution_organic: Apply sodium bicarbonate and improve soil health.

name: Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spot)
cause: Caused by Pseudocercospora vitis, forming small brown lesions on leaves.
solution_pesticide: Apply copper-based fungicides.
solution_organic: Ensure good air circulation and remove infected leaves.

name: Grape___healthy
cause: No disease detected, plant is in good condition.
solution_pesticide: Monitor regularly and apply preventive treatments as needed.
solution_organic: Maintain good pruning and fertilization practices.

name: Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening)
cause: Caused by Candidatus Liberibacter spp., spread by Asian citrus psyllids.
solution_pesticide: Apply systemic insecticides like imidacloprid.
solution_organic: Use neem oil and introduce natural predators of psyllids.

name: Tomato___Bacterial_spot
cause: Caused by Xanthomonas spp., leading to dark, water-soaked leaf spots.
solution_pesticide: Use copper-based fungicides and bactericides.
solution_organic: Apply compost tea and avoid overhead watering.

name: Tomato___Early_blight
cause: Caused by Alternaria solani, forming brown concentric rings on leaves.
solution_pesticide: Use chlorothalonil or copper-based fungicides.
solution_organic: Mulch soil to reduce spore splash and remove infected leaves.

name: Tomato___Late_blight
cause: Caused by Phytophthora infestans, leading to rapid leaf decay.
solution_pesticide: Use mancozeb or metalaxyl-based fungicides.
solution_organic: Remove infected plants and use resistant varieties.

name: Tomato___healthy
cause: No disease detected, plant is in good condition.
solution_pesticide: Regularly monitor for pests and apply fungicides as needed.
solution_organic: Ensure crop rotation and proper ventilation.

name: Peach___Bacterial_spot
cause: Caused by Xanthomonas arboricola, leading to small, dark lesions on leaves and fruits.
solution_pesticide: Use copper-based bactericides and streptomycin sprays.
solution_organic: Prune infected branches and avoid overhead watering.

name: Peach___healthy
cause: No disease detected, plant is in good condition.
solution_pesticide: Regular monitoring and preventive treatments if needed.
solution_organic: Ensure proper air circulation and balanced fertilization.

name: Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot
cause: Caused by Xanthomonas campestris, leading to black water-soaked lesions.
solution_pesticide: Apply copper-based fungicides and bactericides.
solution_organic: Use disease-free seeds and rotate crops.

name: Pepper,_bell___healthy
cause: No disease detected, plant is in good condition.
solution_pesticide: Preventive monitoring and fungicide application if necessary.
solution_organic: Ensure proper irrigation and soil health.

name: Potato___Early_blight
cause: Caused by Alternaria solani, forming concentric ring spots on leaves.
solution_pesticide: Use chlorothalonil or azoxystrobin fungicides.
solution_organic: Apply compost tea and rotate crops.

name: Potato___Late_blight
cause: Caused by Phytophthora infestans, leading to rapid leaf decay and rot.
solution_pesticide: Use mancozeb or metalaxyl-based fungicides.
solution_organic: Remove infected plants and ensure good ventilation.

name: Potato___healthy
cause: No disease detected, plant is in good condition.
solution_pesticide: Monitor regularly and apply preventive treatments if needed.
solution_organic: Ensure proper drainage and fertilization.

name: Raspberry___healthy
cause: No disease detected, plant is in good condition.
solution_pesticide: Preventive monitoring and fungicide application if necessary.
solution_organic: Maintain good pruning and pest control.

name: Soybean___healthy
cause: No disease detected, plant is in good condition.
solution_pesticide: Monitor for early signs of disease and pests.
solution_organic: Use crop rotation and natural pest deterrents.

name: Squash___Powdery_mildew
cause: Caused by Podosphaera xanthii, forming white powdery spots on leaves.
solution_pesticide: Use sulfur-based fungicides or potassium bicarbonate.
solution_organic: Apply neem oil and improve airflow around plants.

name: Strawberry___Leaf_scorch
cause: Caused by Diplocarpon earliana, leading to reddish-brown leaf spots.
solution_pesticide: Use fungicides like myclobutanil or captan.
solution_organic: Ensure good soil drainage and remove infected leaves.

name: Strawberry___healthy
cause: No disease detected, plant is in good condition.
solution_pesticide: Regular monitoring and preventive treatments if needed.
solution_organic: Maintain good watering practices and remove weeds.

name: Tomato___Leaf_Mold
cause: Caused by the fungus Passalora fulva, leading to yellowing and mold growth on leaves.
solution_pesticide: Apply chlorothalonil or copper-based fungicides.
solution_organic: Increase air circulation and avoid overhead watering.

name: Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot
cause: Caused by Septoria lycopersici, forming small, dark leaf spots with light centers.
solution_pesticide: Use mancozeb or chlorothalonil fungicides.
solution_organic: Remove infected leaves and practice crop rotation.

name: Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider_mite
cause: Caused by Tetranychus urticae, leading to yellow stippling and webbing on leaves.
solution_pesticide: Apply miticides such as abamectin or bifenthrin.
solution_organic: Use neem oil and encourage natural predators like ladybugs.

name: Tomato___Target_Spot
cause: Caused by Corynespora cassiicola, leading to dark lesions on leaves and fruits.
solution_pesticide: Use azoxystrobin or copper-based fungicides.
solution_organic: Ensure proper spacing and remove infected plant parts.

name: Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus
cause: Caused by a virus transmitted by whiteflies, leading to curled and yellowed leaves.
solution_pesticide: Use imidacloprid or pyriproxyfen for whitefly control.
solution_organic: Use reflective mulches and introduce predatory insects.

name: Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus
cause: Caused by Tomato mosaic virus (ToMV), leading to mottled, distorted leaves.
solution_pesticide: No direct chemical control; remove infected plants.
solution_organic: Disinfect tools and avoid handling plants when wet.
